name: Maududi
text: The time of people's reckoning has drawn near, and yet they turn aside in heedlessness.

name: Maududi
text: Whenever any fresh admonition comes to them from their Lord they barely heed it and remain immersed in play,

name: Maududi
text: their hearts being set on other concerns. The wrong-doers whisper to one another: "This person is no more than a mortal like yourselves. Will you, then, be enchanted by sorcery while you see?"

name: Maududi
text: He said: "My Lord knows well all that is spoken in the heavens and the earth. He is All-Hearing, All- Knowing."

name: Maududi
text: They say: "Nay, these are confused dreams; nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign, even as the Messengers of the past were sent with signs."

name: Maududi
text: Not one township that We destroyed before them believed. Would they, then, believe?

name: Maududi
text: (O Muhammad), even before you We never sent any other than human beings as Messengers, and to them We sent revelation. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know.

name: Maududi
text: We did not endow the Messengers with bodies that would need no food; nor were they immortals.

name: Maududi
text: Then We fulfilled the promise We had made to them: We rescued them and those whom We wished, and We destroyed those who exceeded all bounds.

name: Maududi
text: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?

name: Maududi
text: How many a wrong-doing town did We shatter and then raise up another people.

name: Maududi
text: Then, when they perceived Our chastisement they took to their heels and fled.

name: Maududi
text: (They were told): "Flee not, but return to your comforts and to your dwellings. You are likely to be questioned."

name: Maududi
text: They said: "Woe to us; surely we were wrong-doers."

name: Maududi
text: They did not cease to cry this until We reduced them to stubble, still and silent.

name: Maududi
text: We did not create in sport the heavens and the earth and all that lies between the two.

name: Maududi
text: Had it been Our will to find a pastime, We would have found one near at hand; if at all We were inclined to do so.

name: Maududi
text: Nay, We hurl the Truth at falsehood so that the Truth crushes falsehood, and lo! it vanishes. Woe to you for what you utter!

name: Maududi
text: To Him belongs whosoever dwells in the heavens and on earth. Those (angels) that are with Him neither disdain to serve Him out of pride, nor do they weary of it.

name: Maududi
text: They glorify Him night and day, without flagging.

name: Maududi
text: Have they taken earthly gods who are such that they raise up the dead to life?

name: Maududi
text: Had there been any gods in the heavens and the earth apart from Allah, the order of both the heavens and the earth would have gone to ruins. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Throne, Who is far above their false descriptions of Him.

name: Maududi
text: None shall question Him about what He does, but they shall be questioned.

name: Maududi
text: Have they taken gods other than Him? Say, (O Muhammad): "Bring forth your proof! Here is the Book with admonition for those of my time and there are also scriptures with admonition for people before me." But most people do not know the Truth, and have, therefore, turned away from it.

name: Maududi
text: Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."

name: Maududi
text: They say: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken to Himself a son." Glory be to Him! Those whom they so designate are only His honoured servants.

name: Maududi
text: They do not outstrip Him in speech and only act as He commands.

name: Maududi
text: He knows whatever is before them and whatsoever is remote from them and they do not intercede except for him, intercession on whose behalf pleases Him, and they stand constantly in awe of Him.

name: Maududi
text: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong-doers.

name: Maududi
text: Did the unbelievers (who do not accept the teaching of the Prophet) not realize that the heavens and the earth were one solid mass, then We tore them apart, and We made every living being out of water? Will they, then, not believe (that We created all this)?

name: Maududi
text: And We placed firm mountains on earth lest it should sway with them, and We made wide paths in them that they may find their way;

name: Maududi
text: and We made the sky a secure canopy; and yet they turn away from these Signs.

name: Maududi
text: It is He Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Each of them is floating in its orbit.

name: Maududi
text: (O Muhammad), We did not grant everlasting life to any human being even before you. If you were to die, will they live for ever?

name: Maududi
text: Every living being shall taste death and We shall subject you to ill and good by way of trial, and to Us shall all of you be eventually sent back.

name: Maududi
text: When the unbelievers see you they make you an object of fun, saying: "Is he the one who mentions your gods?" They say so, and yet they reject with disdain the very mention of the Most Compassionate Lord.

name: Maududi
text: Man is hasty by nature. I shall certainly show you My Signs. Do not ask Me to be hasty.

name: Maududi
text: They say: "(Tell us) when will the threat of punishment come to pass if you are truthful?"

name: Maududi
text: If only the unbelievers knew of the Hour when they shall not be able to keep off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs; nor shall they be helped.

name: Maududi
text: That will suddenly come upon them and stupefy them. They shall not be able to ward it off, nor shall they be granted any respite.

name: Maududi
text: Other Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who scoffed at the Messengers were overtaken by the same scourge that they had scoffed at.

name: Maududi
text: Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Who protects you, during the night or the day from the Most Compassionate Lord?" And yet they turn away from the Admonition of their Lord.

name: Maududi
text: Do they have any gods who would protect them against Us? They have no power even to help themselves; nor do they enjoy Our support.

name: Maududi
text: Nay, We generously provided them and their fathers, and they enjoyed Our provision for long. Do they not see that We are now advancing into their territory, diminishing it from different sides? Is it they, then, who will triumph?"

name: Maududi
text: Tell them: "I only warn you by the Revelation." But the deaf do not hear the cry when they are warned.

name: Maududi
text: Were only the slightest whiff from your Lord's punishment to touch them, they would cry out: "Woe to us; we were indeed wrong-doers."

name: Maududi
text: We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.

name: Maududi
text: Surely We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God-fearing,

name: Maududi
text: for those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and dread the Hour (of Reckoning).

name: Maududi
text: This is a Blessed Admonition that We have revealed. Are you, then, going to reject it?

name: Maududi
text: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

name: Maududi
text: Recall, when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"

name: Maududi
text: They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

name: Maududi
text: He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."

name: Maududi
text: They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"

name: Maududi
text: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.

name: Maududi
text: By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."

name: Maududi
text: Then he broke them all into pieces, sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.

name: Maududi
text: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong-doers."

name: Maududi
text: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

name: Maududi
text: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."

name: Maududi
text: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

name: Maududi
text: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong-doers."

name: Maududi
text: Then their minds were turned upside down, and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."

name: Maududi
text: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

name: Maududi
text: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"

name: Maududi
text: They said: "Burn him, and come to the support of your gods, if you are going to do anything."

name: Maududi
text: We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."

name: Maududi
text: They had sought to do evil to him, but We caused them to be the worst losers,

name: Maududi
text: and We saved him and Lot and brought him to the land upon which We had bestowed Our blessings for all the people of the world.

name: Maududi
text: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, making each of them righteous.

name: Maududi
text: And We made them into leaders to guide people in accordance with Our command, and We inspired them to good works, and to establish Prayers and to give Zakah. They worshipped Us alone.

name: Maududi
text: We bestowed upon Lot sound judgement and knowledge, and We delivered him from the city that was immersed in foul deeds. They were indeed a wicked people, exceedingly disobedient.

name: Maududi
text: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Verily he was of the righteous.

name: Maududi
text: We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before; We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress

name: Maududi
text: and We helped him against a people who rejected Our signs as false. They were indeed an evil people and so We drowned them all.

name: Maududi
text: We bestowed the same favour upon David and Solomon. Recall, when they gave judgement regarding a tillage into which the sheep of some people had strayed at night, and We were witnesses to their judgement.

name: Maududi
text: We guided Solomon to the right verdict, and We had granted each of them judgement and knowledge. We made the mountains and the birds celebrate the praise of Allah with David. It was We Who did all this.

name: Maududi
text: It was We Who taught him the art of making coats of mail for your benefit so that it may protect you from each other's violence. Do you, then, give thanks?

name: Maududi
text: And We subdued the strongly raging wind to Solomon which blew at his bidding towards the land We blessed. We know everything.

name: Maududi
text: And We subdued many devils who dived (into the sea) for him and carried out other jobs besides that. We kept watch over all of them.

name: Maududi
text: We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job. Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."

name: Maududi
text: We accepted his prayer and removed the affliction from him, and We not only restored to him his family but as many more with them as a mercy from Us and as a lesson to the worshippers.

name: Maududi
text: And (We bestowed the same favour) upon Ishmael, Idris and Dhu al-Kifl, for they were all steadfast.

name: Maududi
text: And We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were of the righteous.

name: Maududi
text: And We bestowed Our favour upon Dhu al-Nun. Recall, when he went forth enraged, thinking We have no power to take him to task. Eventually he cried out in the darkness:" There is no god but You. Glory be to You! I have done wrong."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon We accepted his prayer, and rescued him from grief. Thus do We rescue the believers.

name: Maududi
text: And We bestowed favour upon Zechariah, when he cried to his Lord: "Lord! Leave me not solitary (without any issue). You are the Best Inheritor."

name: Maududi
text: So We accepted his prayer and bestowed upon him John, and We made his wife fit (to bear a child). Verily they hastened in doing good works and called upon Us with longing and fear, and humbled themselves to Us.

name: Maududi
text: And also recall the woman who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a Sign to the whole world.

name: Maududi
text: Verily this community of yours is a single community, and I am your Lord; so worship Me.

name: Maududi
text: But they tore asunder their faith into many parts. But to Us they are bound to return.

name: Maududi
text: Then whosoever does righteous works, while believing, his striving will not go unappreciated. We record them all for him.

name: Maududi
text: It has been ordained against every town that We ever destroyed that they shall not return (to enjoy a new lease of life)

name: Maududi
text: until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,

name: Maududi
text: and the time for the fulfilment of the true promise of Allah draws near, whereupon the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in fear, and they will say: "Woe to us, we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we were wrongdoers."

name: Maududi
text: (They will be told): "Verily you and the gods you worshipped beside Allah are the fuel of Hell. All of you are bound to arrive there.

name: Maududi
text: Had these indeed been gods they would not have gone there. But (as it is), all of you shall ever abide in it."

name: Maududi
text: There they shall groan with anguish and the din and noise in Hell will not let them hear anything.

name: Maududi
text: But for those whom We had decided to favour with good reward, they shall be kept far removed from Hell.

name: Maududi
text: They shall not hear even a whisper of it, and they shall live for ever in the delights which they had desired.

name: Maududi
text: The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."

name: Maududi
text: On that Day We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll for writing. Even as We originated the creation first so We shall repeat it. This is a promise binding on Us; and so We shall do.

name: Maududi
text: Surely We wrote in the Psalms, after the exhortation, that the earth shall be inherited by My righteous servants.

name: Maududi
text: Herein, surely, is a message for those devoted to worship.

name: Maududi
text: We have sent you forth as nothing but mercy to people of the whole world.

name: Maududi
text: Say: "It is revealed to me that your God is only One God. Will you, then, submit to Him?"

name: Maududi
text: If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised is near or distant.

name: Maududi
text: Indeed He knows what you say loudly and what you hide.

name: Maududi
text: I think that this [reprieve] is possibly a trial for you, an opportunity to enjoy yourselves until an appointed time."

name: Maududi
text: The Messenger said: "My Lord! Judge with truth. Our Compassionate Lord alone is our support against your (blasphemous) utterances."
